ARABIC: فَتَقَطَّعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ زُبُرًا كُلُّ حِزْبٍۭ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ فَرِحُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But they disagreed and split up, dividing into sects, each party exulting in what it had.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But then they divided up their order into different creeds, each section rejoicing in what it had come to have.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But people later cut up their religion into bits, each group rejoicing in what they have.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The people divided themselves into many sects, each with their own book and each happy with whatever they had.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: But their nations broke their tasks into pieces; every group happy with what it has.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But they have broken their religion among them into sects, each group rejoicing in what is with it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But they cut off their religion among themselves into sects, each part rejoicing in that which is with them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: But they split in their affair between them into sects, each party rejoicing in what is with them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But they (mankind) have broken their religion among them into sects, each group rejoicing in its tenets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Yet they divided themselves into factions, each rejoicing in what they had.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then they cut their affair among them in regard to the Scriptures: each band in that which is with them rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But they fragmented their religion among themselves, each party boasting about what it had.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But people have cut off their affair (of unity), between them, into sects: each party rejoices in that which is with itself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But they (men) have broken their religion among them into sects, each group rejoicing in its belief.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Yet they have split their affairs between themselves into sects, each rejoicing in what it has.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But they tore themselves into sects; each party happy with what they have.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But the people divided their religion among them into sects - each faction, in what it has, rejoicing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:53] But they, the followers, split into sects regarding their affair, their religion (zuburan, ‘sects’, is a circumstantial qualifier of the subject of the verb taqatta‘ū, ‘they split’), in other words, [they became] opposing parties, the likes of the Jews and the Christians and others, each party rejoicing in, exultant with, what they had, that is, with the religion they had.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But they (mankind) have broken their religion among them into sects) so they split among themselves with regard to religion into different groups: groups of Jews, Christians, idolaters and Magians, (each sect) the adherents of each religion and sect (rejoicing in its tenets) being impressed with what they have.
